meanings.definition: To perform as a musician or entertainer
meanings.sent1: She gigged at the local cafe every Friday night.
meanings.sent2: The band gigged at the music festival last weekend.
meanings.sent3: The clown gigged at the birthday party and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The magician gigged on stage, mesmerizing the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent5: The singer gigged with passion, filling the room with beautiful melodies.

meanings.definition: To catch or spear with a gig
meanings.sent1: He gigged a fish from the river for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman gigged a trout with precision.
meanings.sent3: The hunter gigged a frog for his collection.
meanings.sent4: She gigged the target with her accurate aim.
meanings.sent5: The spearfisher gigged a large octopus in the deep sea.

meanings.definition: To work temporary jobs or engagements
meanings.sent1: During summer break, she gigged at the ice cream shop.
meanings.sent2: He gigged as a delivery driver between acting gigs.
meanings.sent3: The student gigged as a tutor to earn extra money.
meanings.sent4: She gigged at different events to save up for a trip.
meanings.sent5: The freelancer gigged on various projects to gain experience.
